bestBHT.bht: When the disciples surveyed their surroundings in an instant, they found themselves alone with Jesus. Mark's depiction emphasizes the suddenness of this change, intensifying the disciples' awe and fear. The Greek word used for suddenly is unique to this passage in the New Testament. The account suggests that Jesus' solitary presence signifies His authority, love, and glory. Though the withdrawal itself may not have been immediate, the disciples' perception of the situation was abrupt. They were left only with Jesus, and the voice they heard was directed solely at Him.
